bug.short_desc: Starting firefox from command line with -private option causes two windows to be opened

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Starting firefox from command line with -private option causes two windows to be opened
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open a command windows/shell 2. Type "c:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe" -private 3. Actual Results: Two windows are opened. First window contains one tab showing Private Browsing page. The second contains one tab on url about:home
Expected Results: One window to open on either default home page or if url specified on command line then that site
Following Bug 645995, comment 2, might prove useful in deciding whether this is a bug or not. Comment 2 read:
"This is by design. Permanent private browsing mode is not something that we want to advertize in the primary UI." (Ehsan Akhgari [:ehsan])

Works for Me on: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110406 Firefox/4.2a1pre -> Latest trunk Marking this as Resolved. If you can still reproduce the issue, feel free to reopen it. Thanks for your report
